blocks.value: Saint Mark, also called John Mark, was a companion of Saint Peter and Saint Paul. He is the author of the second Gospel, which is believed to record Peter's eyewitness testimony of Jesus' life.

Mark's Gospel, the shortest and likely the first written, portrays Jesus as the suffering Servant and Son of God. It emphasizes Christ's actions and miracles, presenting a fast-paced narrative of His ministry, death, and resurrection.
Founder of the Church in Alexandria

Tradition holds that Mark founded the Church in Alexandria, Egypt, and became its first bishop. He was martyred there, dragged through the streets by a mob. He is the patron saint of Egypt and his symbol is the winged lion.
